Values are in kilograms, i.e. kg
(1 kg = 1000 grams = ~2.2 pounds = ~35 ounces)
(1 kg = mass of 1 liter of water = ~2.2 pints of water, ~weight of a 5cm (~1 inch) cube of steel)
(.0025 kg = 2.5 grams = weight of a silver dime)
(See Buiders TWiki MassValues for more example values)" areadonly="false" aquery="query_intrinsic_mass"/> <SID:Attribute id="density" atype="lpc_flt" acomment="How dense is the object itself (not its contents)?
Values are in specific gravity. If the density is less then 1 it will float in water, greater then 1 it will sink
(balsa=0.1, mediumwood=0.6, apple=0.8, ice=0.9, water=1, heavy fabric=1.4, stone=2.5, steel=8 )
(See Buiders TWiki DensityValues for more example values)" areadonly="false" aquery="query_intrinsic_density"/>
